an4.72:1: "Bhikkhus, a bhikkhu who possesses four qualities is practicing the unmistakable way and has laid the groundwork for the destruction of the taints. What four? The thought of renunciation, the thought of good will, the thought of non-harming, and right view.[n.767] Right view(sammādiṭṭhi)is the first factor of the noble eightfold path, and the three types of wholesome thought are collectively right intention(sammāsaṅkappa), the second path factor.A bhikkhu who possesses these four qualitiesis practicing the unmistakable way and has laid the groundwork for the destruction of the taints."
